questions.question: What is the fundamental principle governing all engineering operations onboard according to the Company’s policy?
options: To conduct engineering tasks quickly to save fuel
To carry out all engineering operations safely, efficiently, and in strict conformance with laws, regulations, and good engineering practices
To perform maintenance only during port stays
To prioritize cost savings over technical standards
questions.answer: To carry out all engineering operations safely, efficiently, and in strict conformance with laws, regulations, and good engineering practices
questions.explanation: Engineering operations must always align with legal, regulatory, and best-practice standards to ensure safety and efficiency.

questions.question: According to the policy, whose instructions must be strictly followed during maintenance and operations?
options: The Port State Control inspector
The equipment maker’s instructions
The charterer’s representative
The Class surveyor’s verbal guidance
questions.explanation: Following manufacturer instructions ensures maintenance and operation align with design specifications and safety standards.

questions.question: What must engineering personnel ensure when performing tasks or supervising others?
options: That operations follow COSWP recommendations and are carried out without risk
That only senior officers are involved in maintenance
That all work is delegated to external contractors
That tasks are completed as quickly as possible regardless of risk
questions.answer: That operations follow COSWP recommendations and are carried out without risk
questions.explanation: Compliance with COSWP guidance minimizes hazards and ensures safe working practices in the Engine Room.

questions.question: Why must double-unit machinery systems have equal operating time for both units?
options: To comply with classification survey requirements
To ensure even wear, reliability, and operational readiness of both units
To maintain symmetry in the ship’s layout
To meet environmental reporting obligations
questions.answer: To ensure even wear, reliability, and operational readiness of both units
questions.explanation: Balanced operation prevents uneven wear, ensuring both units remain serviceable and dependable when needed.

questions.question: What specific tests must be conducted by Engine Room officers as part of regular safety checks?
options: Steering gear emergency power tests only
Testing of automatic changeover devices during startup and shutdown, and system shutdowns at regular intervals
Hull integrity ultrasonic checks
Main engine cylinder pressure verification
questions.answer: Testing of automatic changeover devices during startup and shutdown, and system shutdowns at regular intervals
questions.explanation: Regular testing ensures automatic systems and shutdown mechanisms function correctly during critical operations.

questions.question: What verification responsibility does the Chief Engineer have during their contract?
options: To confirm that Engine Room procedures and standards are properly maintained as per Chapter 12 and form 014.12.AUD.C/E’s Verification Assessment
To review the Master’s Safety Management audit
To conduct monthly deck maintenance reports
To oversee shipboard financial accounts
questions.answer: To confirm that Engine Room procedures and standards are properly maintained as per Chapter 12 and form 014.12.AUD.C/E’s Verification Assessment
questions.explanation: The Chief Engineer must verify compliance with Company engineering standards and report findings through the designated audit form.

questions.question: What is the primary reason for maintaining and frequently checking all machinery and equipment?
options: To reduce audit workload during inspections
To ensure proper operation and prevent breakdowns or unsafe conditions
To satisfy oil major requirements only
To maintain the vessel’s aesthetic condition
questions.answer: To ensure proper operation and prevent breakdowns or unsafe conditions
questions.explanation: Regular maintenance ensures reliability, safety, and compliance with operational and safety standards.

questions.question: What best describes the Chief Engineer’s leadership role in the application of engineering procedures?
options: To delegate all technical matters to junior engineers
To ensure consistent application of standards and verify procedural compliance within the Engine Room
To focus solely on administrative reporting
To review only environmental documentation
questions.answer: To ensure consistent application of standards and verify procedural compliance within the Engine Room
questions.explanation: The Chief Engineer’s oversight ensures all personnel follow SMS and engineering standards for safety and operational efficiency.
